get.description:
Authentication profiles to be used for Central NAC.

Authentication profile defines the authentication method, authentication sources, and additional attributes used to authenticate users on the associated networks.

Authentication profiles must be configured with default query parameters.

post.description:
Authentication profile to be used for Central NAC.

Authentication profile defines the authentication method, authentication sources, and additional attributes used to authenticate users on the associated networks.

Authentication profiles must be configured with default query parameters.

parameters.name: authProfileId
parameters.description: Unique immutable identifier for auth profile.

get.description:
Authentication profile to be used for Central NAC.

Authentication profile defines the authentication method, authentication sources, and additional attributes used to authenticate users on the associated networks.

Authentication profiles must be configured with default query parameters.

parameters.name: authProfileId
parameters.description: Unique immutable identifier for auth profile.

patch.description:
Authentication profile to be used for Central NAC.

Authentication profile defines the authentication method, authentication sources, and additional attributes used to authenticate users on the associated networks.

Authentication profiles must be configured with default query parameters.

parameters.name: authProfileId
parameters.description: Unique immutable identifier for auth profile.

delete.description:
Authentication profile to be used for Central NAC.

Authentication profile defines the authentication method, authentication sources, and additional attributes used to authenticate users on the associated networks.

Authentication profiles must be configured with default query parameters.

parameters.name: authProfileId
parameters.description: Unique immutable identifier for auth profile.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaCdaAuthProfile_AuthProfilesSchema.description:
Authentication profiles to be used for Central NAC.

Authentication profile defines the authentication method, authentication sources, and additional attributes used to authenticate users on the associated networks.

Authentication profiles must be configured with default query parameters.

profile.description:
Authentication profile to be used for Central NAC.

Authentication profile defines the authentication method, authentication sources, and additional attributes used to authenticate users on the associated networks.

Authentication profiles must be configured with default query parameters.

auth-profile-id.description: Unique immutable identifier for auth profile.

auth-type.description: Type of authentication method to determine profile configuration.

items.description: Reference to the identity store(s) to be used for authentication.
Reference to the wired/wlan network to be used for authentication.

wired.description:
Indicate if auth profile applies to wired profiles.

When wired is true, and auth-type is CAPTIVE_PORTAL, a wired-profile must also be configured.

organization-name.description: Organization name used for provisioning in onboarding workflows.

portal-profile.description: Reference to the portal profile that defines the required web portal customizations.

dpp.description: Indicate if Wi-Fi Easy Connect (DPP) is supported on this network.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

auth-profile-id.description: Unique immutable identifier for auth profile.

auth-type.description: Type of authentication method to determine profile configuration.

items.description: Reference to the identity store(s) to be used for authentication.
Reference to the wired/wlan network to be used for authentication.

wired.description:
Indicate if auth profile applies to wired profiles.

When wired is true, and auth-type is CAPTIVE_PORTAL, a wired-profile must also be configured.

organization-name.description: Organization name used for provisioning in onboarding workflows.

portal-profile.description: Reference to the portal profile that defines the required web portal customizations.

dpp.description: Indicate if Wi-Fi Easy Connect (DPP) is supported on this network.

allow-all.description: All devices are allowed on the network if set to true.

ArubaCdaAuthProfile_WiredProfileConfig.description: Configuration for an authentication profile when supporting a wired network.

wired-profile.description:
Configuration for an authentication profile when supporting a wired network.

The wired field must be true, and the auth-type must be CAPTIVE_PORTAL, to configure a wired-profile.

items.description:
The names of the Access Point (AP) port profiles with which this authentication profile will used.

A port profile defines parameters on the port such as VLAN settings, authentication methods, link speed, PoE settings, and more.

For a CAPTIVE_PORTAL authentication profile, only wired interfaces with one of these port profiles will be configured with the captive portal.

At least one port profile must be specified.

At most 100 port profiles may be specified.

default-policy.description:
Default policy to apply to Central NAC captive portal network sessions.

The auth-type must be CAPTIVE_PORTAL to configure a default-policy.

allow-mac-caching.description: Whether users can resume a valid network session via MAC address caching and MAC authentication.

session-timeout.description:
Maximum time allowed for the session before it should be terminated.

Null for the default session timeout or a minimum of 1 (one).

The default session timeout is 28,800 seconds (i.e. 8 hours).

Units are in seconds.

session-data-quota.description:
Maximum IO allowed for the session before it should be terminated.

Null for no limit or a minimum of 1 (one).

Units are in MB (1,048,576 bytes).

x-enumDescriptions.ACCOUNT: Daily time and IO quotas are enforced on a per-account basis.
x-enumDescriptions.DEVICE: Daily time and IO quotas are enforced on a per-device basis.

periodic-quota-subject.x-typeDescription: An enumeration that controls whether daily time and IO quotas are to be enforced on a per-account or per-device basis.
periodic-quota-subject.description: Controls whether daily time and IO quotas are to be enforced on a per-account or per-device basis.

periodic-time-quota.description:
Maximum time per day allowed for the account, or device, before active sessions should be terminated.

Limiting by account, or by device, is controlled by the periodic-quota-subject.

Null for no limit or a minimum of 1 (one).

Units are in seconds.

periodic-data-quota.description:
Maximum IO per day allowed for the account, or device, before active sessions should be terminated.

Limiting by account, or by device, is controlled by the periodic-quota-subject.

Null for no limit or a minimum of 1 (one).

Units are in MB (1,048,576 bytes).

simultaneous-use.description:
Maximum number of simultaneous network sessions allowed for each account.

Null for no limit or a minimum of 1 (one).

Note that this limit is per-account only.

ArubaCdaEapProfile_EapProfile.description: EAP authentication profile top level grouping

cert-valid-days.description: The number of days validity for server issued EAP-TLS client certificates.

use-ocsp.description: Whether to check EAP-TLS client certificate validity with OCSP.

use-custom-server.description: Whether to use a custom EAP server.

use-custom-client-ca-chain.description: Whether to use a custom EAP client CA chain.

client-ca-chain.description: Base64 encoded X.509 trust chain for the client certificates when using EAP-TLS.

ArubaCdaEapProfile_CustomCertificateConf.description: allows to add a custom certificate

server-cert.description: Base64 encoded X.509 cert to use for custom EAP server.

server-key.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.
server-key.description: Private key to use for custom EAP server.

server-key-passphrase.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.
server-key-passphrase.description: Passphrase associated with the server key.

ocsp-url.x-typeDescription:
An ASCII-encoded Uniform Resource Locator (URL) as defined
in RFC 3986, section 1.1.3

x-enumDescriptions.ACCEPT_VALID_CERT: Accept if failure but cert is valid

ocsp-fail-behavior.description: Behavior if ocsp server cannot be reached

ArubaCdaUemProfile_CdaUemProfile.description: Unified Endpoint Management(UEM) profile top level grouping

uem-providers.description: List of UEMs used for Onboarding.

uem-type.description: The type of UEM provider to use for Onboarding.

intune-extension.x-typeDescription: String that only allows printable ASCII characters.
intune-extension.description: Name of the Intune extension to be used for Onboarding.

ArubaCdaUemProfile_ScepEnrollment.description: Configuration to be used for Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol(SCEP) enrollment.

scep-url.x-typeDescription:
An ASCII-encoded Uniform Resource Locator (URL) as defined
in RFC 3986, section 1.1.3

scep-dynamic-challenge-url.x-typeDescription:
An ASCII-encoded Uniform Resource Locator (URL) as defined
in RFC 3986, section 1.1.3
scep-dynamic-challenge-url.description: URL for Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol(SCEP) dynamic challenge.

bearer-token.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.
bearer-token.description: Bearer token used for authenticating request to dynamic challenge url.

authentication-mode.description:
How users are to be authenticated.

When the authentication mode is AUTHENTICATED, the authentication profile's
identity-stores must reference at least one identity store.

When the authentication mode is ANONYMOUS, the authentication profile's
identity-stores must not reference any identity stores.

anonymous-password.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.
anonymous-password.description:
Password for the anonymous user sign in, if required.

The anonymous-password field can only be configured when authentication-mode is ANONYMOUS.

enable-registration.description:
Allow users to register for an account.

The enable-registration field can only be configured when authentication-mode is AUTHENTICATED.

At least one of register-accept-email and register-accept-phone must be true when enable-registration is true.

The registration-identity-store must be configured when enable-registration is true.

register-auto-expire.description:
Automatically set a registered account to expire after the specified duration (ISO 8601 duration).

The register-auto-expire field can only be configured when enable-registration is true.

register-accept-email.description:
Allow users to register using an email address.

The register-accept-email field can only be configured when enable-registration is true.

At least one of register-accept-email and register-accept-phone must be true when enable-registration is true.

register-accept-phone.description:
Allow users to register using a phone number.

The register-accept-phone field can only be configured when enable-registration is true.

At least one of register-accept-email and register-accept-phone must be true when enable-registration is true.

require-sponsor-approval.description:
Require sponsor approval for self-registrations.

If enabled, when a user is registering an account, they must provide the email address of a valid sponsor.
The sponsor will receive an email with a link to then review and approve the registration request.

The require-sponsor-approval field can only be configured when enable-registration is true.

At least one sponsor domain (see sponsor-domains), or sponsor email (see sponsor-emails), must be configured when require-sponsor-approval is true.

verify-registration.description:
Verify that the user actually owns the registered identity (e.g. email address or phone number) by sending an access code that must then be entered to complete registration.

The verify-registration field can only be configured when enable-registration is true.

registration-identity-store.description:
Reference to the identity store to be used for user registrations.

The registration-identity-store must be configured when enable-registration is true.

The registration-identity-store must be a member of the authentication profile's list of identity-stores when enable-registration is true.

The registration-identity-store must be a LOCAL identity store when enable-registration is true.

items.x-typeDescription: A domain name (as supported by Cloud Guest) according to RFC 952 and RFC 1123.
items.description:
Allowed domain names for sponsor email addresses.

The maximum number of sponsor-domains allowed is 50.

When a user is registering an account that requires sponsor approval (see require-sponsor-approval), they must provide the email address of a valid sponsor.

Anyone who has an email address in one of these domains is a valid sponsor.

The sponsor-domains list can only be configured when require-sponsor-approval is true.

At least one sponsor domain (see sponsor-domains), or sponsor email (see sponsor-emails), must be configured when require-sponsor-approval is true.

See also the sponsor-emails field for configuring specific email addresses as valid sponsors.

Both the sponsor-domains and sponsor-emails lists define valid sponsors.

items.x-typeDescription: An email address (as supported by Cloud Guest) according to RFC 5322, limited by RFC 952 and RFC 1123
items.description:
Allowed sponsor email addresses.

The maximum number of sponsor-emails allowed is 100.

When a user is registering an account that requires sponsor approval (see require-sponsor-approval), they must provide the email address of a valid sponsor.

Any one of these email addresses is a valid sponsor.

The sponsor-emails list can only be configured when require-sponsor-approval is true.

At least one sponsor domain (see sponsor-domains), or sponsor email (see sponsor-emails), must be configured when require-sponsor-approval is true.

See also the sponsor-domains field for configuring an entire domain as valid sponsors.

Both the sponsor-domains and sponsor-emails lists define valid sponsors.

allow-internet-on-service-unavailable.description: Allow internet access when the authentication service (RADIUS/RadSec) is unavailable

x-enumDescriptions.AUTOMATIC: Automatically determine whether a CNA (Captive Network Assistant) should be allowed (shown) or bypassed (hidden)
x-enumDescriptions.ALLOW_ALWAYS: Always allow a CNA (Captive Network Assistant) to be shown (i.e. NEVER bypass a CNA)

final-redirection-url.x-typeDescription:
An ASCII-encoded Uniform Resource Locator (URL) as defined
in RFC 3986, section 1.1.3
final-redirection-url.description: A URL to redirect the client to after they have completed the login workflow

network-login-host-override.x-typeDescription: A domain name (as supported by Cloud Guest) according to RFC 952 and RFC 1123.
network-login-host-override.description:
Override the expected host that the Central NAC captive portal should redirect back
to after it has authenticated the user.

The network access device (e.g. an Access Point), at this domain name, will then
complete the final phase of user authentication.

It is recommended to only set this override when using a custom server certificate
on the network access device. This is so that, when the user's web browser is
redirected back to the network access device, the host matches one of the valid
domain names in the certificate (e.g. a subject-alt-name, or the common name).

If set, this value must be a valid domain name.

pre-auth-access-rules.description:
Additional access rules added to the captive portal pre-authentication role.
Use these rules to provide the user with access to HTTP/HTTPS resources before
they have completed the authentication process.

The maximum number of pre-auth-access-rules allowed is 10.

position.description: Position determines the order in which the rules are appended to the pre-authentication role.

destination.description: Destination domain and port to allow.

domain-name.x-typeDescription: A domain name (as supported by Cloud Guest) according to RFC 952 and RFC 1123.

port.x-typeDescription:
A 16-bit port number used by a transport protocol such as TCP
or UDP.
port.description:
Destination TCP port number to allow.
Port numbers are currently restricted to 80 (HTTP) and 443 (HTTPS) only.

ArubaCdaAirpassProfile_CdaAirpassProfile.description: Air Pass profile top level grouping

airpass-profile.description:
Air Pass enables seamless cellular roaming to enterprise networks.
Air Pass profiles can be configured to use SIM based or OpenRoaming workflows for Central NAC.

Air Pass profiles must be configured with default query parameters.

domain-name.x-typeDescription: A domain name (as supported by Cloud Guest) according to RFC 952 and RFC 1123.

items.description: List of passpoint identities that will be used for Air Pass.

site.description: List of site ids where Air Pass should be enabled.

site-id.x-typeDescription: it is a unique ID given to a scope, it is unique across a particular construct

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error401.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error404.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error408.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error412.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error429.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error500.description: Error details returned from the server.
